result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Request for Restitution / Waupaca County Restitution Summary
Thomas Johnson
Preliminary hearing on August 1, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Review hearing on July 29, 2022 at 11:30 am.

1:16 p.m.
ADA Turner appeared for the state.
Defendant appeared via video from the jail, pro se.
The defendant is eligible for SPD representation in both cases, but counsel has not yet been appointed.
The defendant wishes to continue the case until counsel has been appointed.
The Court finds good cause to continue.
Case set for PH on 8-1-22 at 11:30 a.m. in Br. 1 -- in person.
Case set for RH on 7-29-22 at 11:30 a.m. in Br. 1 -- defendant may appear via Zoom if still in custody.
Tomorrow's hearing can be removed from the calendar.
22 CM 180 should be scheduled for AIA on the same dates as shown above.
The defendant's previous written request for amendment of bond is denied by the Court.
Bonds are continued.
from defendant - dated 7/7/22 and 7/11/22

ADA Turner appeared for the state.
Defendant appeared via video from the jail, pro se.
Statements by defendant; request to continue until counsel has been appointed.

The Court finds good cause to continue the preliminary hearing.
PH set for 7-21-22 at 8:30 a.m. in Br. 1 -- in person.
RH set for 7-20-22 at 1 p.m. in Br. 1 -- defendant may appear via Zoom if still in custody.
Preliminary hearing on July 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Review hearing on July 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

DA Isherwood appeared for the state.
Defendant appeared via video from the jail with S. Olsson, intern for SPD.
Mr. Olsson is unsure if the defendant is eligible for SPD services.
The defendant has received a copy of the criminal complaint, waives reading of same.
Statements by counsel.
The Court orders a $2500.00 cash bond.
Conditions:  see bond.
As a condition of confinement, the defendant shall have no contact directly or indirectly with the victim.
